Name: Linear Programming
Description: Objective function and constraints are all linear. The workhorse of optimization.

Name: Mixed-Integer Linear Programming
Description: An LP problem where some decision variables are required to be integers.
Solvability: NP-Hard. Solution time grows exponentially with number of integers.

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Description: Objective function or constraints are nonlinear.
Solvability: Varies widely. Can be very difficult to solve globally.

Name: Convex Optimization
Description: A subclass of NLP where the objective is convex and constraint set is a convex set.
Solvability: Efficiently solvable to a global optimum.

Name: Quadratic Programming
Description: Objective function is quadratic and constraints are linear. A special case of NLP.
Solvability: Efficiently solvable if the Q matrix is positive semi-definite (convex).

Name: Constraint Programming
Description: Focuses on finding feasible solutions satisfying complex logical constraints.
Solvability: NP-Hard. Uses powerful propagation and search techniques.

Name: Stochastic Programming
Description: Optimization under uncertainty. Parameters are known only by their probability distributions.

Name: Robust Optimization
Description: Seeks solutions that are immune to data uncertainty within a predefined uncertainty set.

Name: Dynamic Programming
Description: Solves complex problems by breaking them into simpler subproblems and storing their solutions.
Solvability: Can suffer from the "curse of dimensionality".

Name: Multi-Objective Optimization
Description: Involves multiple conflicting objectives to be optimized simultaneously.
Solvability: No single optimal solution; finds a set of Pareto-optimal solutions.
